intro: Cheilanthes qiaojiaensis, commonly known as the Qiaojia rock fern, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and drought-tolerant nature. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates in high-altitude regions, showcasing adaptations to arid and cool climates. Its fronds are usually short and thick, with a leathery texture that helps conserve moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
